abstract: German newspaper publisher Axel Springer sends unsolicited $1.9 billion offer letter to WAZ Mediengruppe, which is not for sale but which is subject of long-running family drama; WAZ has 50 percent stake in Austrian newspaper Kronen Zeitung, which Springer chief Mathias Dopfner covets.
snippet: Axel Springer sent an unsolicited offer letter to WAZ Mediengruppe, which is not for sale but which is the subject of a long-running family drama.
lead_paragraph: Axel Springer sent an unsolicited offer letter to WAZ Mediengruppe, which is not for sale but which is the subject of a long-running family drama.

headline.main: Dividing to Conquer a Newspaper Empire in Germany
headline.print_headline: A Tangled, Unfriendly Bid Among German Publishers
